description: The `synthetic.training_courses` table represents a catalog of training courses, including their key attributes such as course name, code, description, category, duration, and cost. This table does not participate in any foreign key relationships, indicating that it functions independently in the data model, possibly acting as a reference for other unlisted entities. Each course entry is identified by a unique `course_id` and contains metadata about the course's creation and updates.

columns.name: course_id
columns.description: This column uniquely identifies each training course within the system. It uses sequential integers to assign a distinct identifier to each course record.

columns.name: course_name
columns.description: This column contains descriptive phrases that likely represent titles or themes of various training courses. The exact purpose of each entry is unclear from the available data.

columns.name: course_code
columns.description: This column appears to contain unique identifiers or codes for training courses, used to distinguish one course from another. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: description
columns.description: This column contains brief, fragmented textual descriptions associated with training courses, reflecting various concepts or themes potentially related to course content or objectives. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: category
columns.description: This column appears to categorize training courses with descriptive summaries or themes, although the exact purpose and structure of these descriptions are unclear based on the sample values.

columns.name: duration_hours
columns.description: This column represents the duration of training courses measured in hours, suggesting variability in course lengths. Courses can have diverse durations ranging from under 100 hours to nearly 1,000 hours, reflecting different training intensities or comprehensive coverage.

columns.name: is_mandatory
columns.description: Indicates whether a training course is required for participants, with true signifying mandatory courses. Most courses appear to be optional, as reflected by the predominance of false values.

columns.name: cost
columns.description: This column represents the financial amount associated with training courses offered by the organization. The values indicate varying costs, suggesting that different courses or categories may have different pricing structures.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when a training course entry was created in the system. The timestamp is typically set to the current date and time at the moment of entry creation, but it may be null.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: Indicates the most recent date and time when a record in the training courses table was updated. Purpose unclear from available data.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX training_courses_course_code_key ON synthetic.training_courses USING btree (course_code)
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX training_courses_pkey ON synthetic.training_courses USING btree (course_id)
